member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Collections.EventedDictionary`2.Dispose
member.summary: Frees all resources held by this object, immediately (rather than waiting for Garbage Collection). This can provide a performance increase and avoid memory congestion on objects that hold many or "expensive" (large) external resources.
member.remarks: First fires the Disposing event, which could cancel this operation. When not cancelled, calls the Dispose(bool notFinalized) method, which should overrided in inheriting classes to release their local resources. Finally fires the Disposed event. Use the IsDisposing and IsDisposed properties to avoid using objects that are about to or have been disposed.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Collections.EventedDictionary`2.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inheritors implement the Dipose(bool) method to dispose resources accordingly, depending on whether they have been called proactively or automatically via the finalizer.
member.param: True when called proactively, i.e. Not during garbage collection. Managed resources should not be accessed when this is False, just references and unmangaed resources released.

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.IEventObject
member.summary: Provides methods and events to implement suspend/resume and caching of events. Events are cached when they are not relevant until an atomic operation has completed. This can give great performance gains, especially in graphics related applications.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.IEventObject.EventsAreEnabled
member.summary: Flags that events are current enabled, and will be fired immediately. This can be used by inheriting classes to determine whether to cache or fire events immediately, in conjunction with the ResumeEvents() override.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.IEventObject.SuspendEvents
member.summary: Disables all events until ResumeEvents is called. Implements reference counting to detect when to finally resume events, increasing performance by preventing un-necessary event handling.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.IEventObject.ResumeEvents
member.summary: Resumes all events after SuspendEvents. Automatically fires any pending events when appropriate. Implements reference counting to detect when to finally resume events, at which point the Resume event is fired.

member.summary: Fired when events are suspended the first time, i.e. is not fired when nested.

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.IEventObject.EventsResumed
member.summary: Fired when events are suspended the first time, i.e. is not fired when nested.

member.summary: Overrides the finalizer to ensure any available dispose logic is called.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.PropertyObject.Dispose
member.summary: Frees all resources held by this object, immediately (rather than waiting for Garbage Collection). This can provide a performance increase and avoid memory congestion on objects that hold many or "expensive" (large) external resources.
member.remarks: First fires the Disposing event, which could cancel this operation. When not cancelled, calls the Dispose(bool notFinalized) method, which should overrided in inheriting classes to release their local resources. Finally fires the Disposed event. Use the IsDisposing and IsDisposed properties to avoid using objects that are about to or have been disposed.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.PropertyObject.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inheritors implement the Dipose(bool) method to dispose resources accordingly, depending on whether they have been called proactively or automatically via the finalizer.
member.param: True when called proactively, i.e. Not during garbage collection. Managed resources should not be accessed when this is False, just references and unmangaed resources released.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.PropertyObject.IsDisposing
member.summary: Indicates that this object is committed to the process of Disposing. When this flag is TRUE, do not pass any references or queue it for processing.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.PropertyObject.IsDisposed
member.summary: Indicated that this object has been Disposed. When this flag is TRUE, do not use this object in any way.

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.PropertyObject.Disposing
member.summary: Fires when the Dispose method is called on this object (except when garbage collected).

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.ComponentModel.PropertyObject.Disposed
member.summary: Fires after this object has been Disposed. Use this event to ensure all references are invalidated and any dependent objects are also Disposed or released.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.DataReaderExtensions.GetNullableDateTimeAsOffset(System.Data.IDataRecord,System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Reads a from a record by column name, with conversion to a , using either a specific or system time zone.
member.param: Optional UTC offset to use during conversion. The system time zone is used when not specified, i.e. to covert from a source time which is local, do not specify an offset. To convert from a source time which is UTC, an offset of must be used.
member.returns: Value of the correct type or null when .

remarks.para: This function facilitates standardization of dates with offset, when reading databases which do not take time zones into account.

When the local system time zone is used it will only work reliably when running on systems in the same time zone as the original database system. Hence it should only be used during migration or when the geographical location is fixed.

remarks.para: This function facilitates standardization of dates with offset, when reading databases which do not take time zones into account.

When the local system time zone is used it will only work reliably when running on systems in the same time zone as the original database system. Hence it should only be used during migration or when the geographical location is fixed.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.DataReaderExtensions.GetDateTimeAsOffset(System.Data.IDataRecord,System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Reads a nullable by column name with conversion to a , using either a specific or system time zone.
member.param: Optional UTC offset to use during conversion. The system time zone is used when not specified, i.e. to covert from a source time which is local, do not specify an offset. To convert from a source time which is UTC, an offset of must be used.
member.returns: Value of the correct type or null when .

remarks.para: This function facilitates standardization of dates with offset, when reading databases which do not take time zones into account.

When the local system time zone is used it will only work reliably when running on systems in the same time zone as the original database system. Hence it should only be used during migration or when the geographical location is fixed.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.DataReaderExtensions.GetDateTimeAsOffset(System.Data.IDataRecord,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})

member.param: Index of the column to read.

Optional UTC offset to use during conversion. The system time zone is used when not specified, i.e. to covert from a source time which is local, do not specify an offset. To convert from a source time which is UTC, an offset of must be used.

remarks.para: This function facilitates standardization of dates with offset, when reading databases which do not take time zones into account.

When the local system time zone is used it will only work reliably when running on systems in the same time zone as the original database system. Hence it should only be used during migration or when the geographical location is fixed.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.TimeZoneId
member.summary: ID of the time zone in which this schedule item was defined. All dates, times, days, months and years expressed this schedule are expressed in this time zone (normally the user's local time). The time zone is applied to current time in order to compare whether it matches the schedule or not. This must work on different servers across the world than where the user is located, especially significant for global intranet and internet applications, e.g. an item scheduled in the UK at 23:30 on Tuesday needs to be processed at 00:30 on Wednesday by server in Germany.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.Start
member.summary: Date and time of a single occurrence, or start date and time of a recurring schedule item.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.Duration
member.summary: Duration in minutes.

member.summary: Date and time when the schedule ends, taking into account duration and all occurrences. Will be null when this item has with an unlimited number of .

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.Recurrence
member.summary: Recurrence of the schedule, or null for a one-off event.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.RecurrenceSpecified
member.summary: Omits the property from XML serialization when it is default.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the recurrence interval.
member.remarks: Range depends on . None = 0. Hourly = 0-23 hours (for 24+ hours use daily recurrence). Daily = 0-30 days (for 31+ days use monthly recurrence). Weekly = 0-51 weeks (for 52+ weeks use yearly recurrence). Months = 0-11 months (for 11+ months use yearly recurrence). Yearly = 0-4 years (more than 4 years is unrealistic, e.g. 4 could be used for leap years).

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.IntervalSpecified
member.summary: Omits the property from XML serialization when it is empty.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.ScheduleItem.Offset
member.summary: Optional offset when a relative recurrence is required, e.g. last day of a month cannot be expressed with day numbers as each month varies in length.

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject
member.summary: Provides a base object which provides greater control over object lifetime and memory management.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject.Finalize
member.summary: Overrides the finalizer to ensure any available dispose logic is called.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject.Dispose
member.summary: Frees all resources held by this object, immediately (rather than waiting for Garbage Collection). This can provide a performance increase and avoid memory congestion on objects that hold many or "expensive" (large) external resources.
member.remarks: First fires the Disposing event, which could cancel this operation. When not canceled, calls the method, which should be overridden in inheriting classes to release their local resources. Finally fires the Disposed event. Use the IsDisposing and IsDisposed properties to avoid using objects that are about to or have been disposed.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inheritors implement the method to dispose resources accordingly, depending on whether they have been called proactively or automatically via the finalizer.
member.param: True when called proactively, i.e. Not during garbage collection. Managed resources should not be accessed when this is False, just references and unmanaged resources released.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject.IsDisposing
member.summary: Indicates that this object is committed to the process of Disposing. When this flag is true, do not pass any references or queue it for processing.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject.IsDisposed
member.summary: Indicated that this object has been Disposed. When this flag is true, do not use this object in any way.

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject.Disposing
member.summary: Fires when the Dispose method is called on this object (except when garbage collected).

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.DisposableObject.Disposed
member.summary: Fires after this object has been Disposed. Use this event to ensure all references are invalidated and any dependent objects are also Disposed or released.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Net.MimeExtensions.FindLine(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Tests a MIME data buffer for a complete ASCII line. Returns the length of the current line without any CR and the LF, and the offset to the next line including any CR and the LF.
member.param: Offset to start searching the buffer.
Maximum length to search in the buffer from the offset.
Returns the length of the current line without any CR and the LF, when found, else 0.
Returns the index of the next line including any CR and the LF, when found, else -1.
member.returns: True when a complete line was found, otherwise false. Blank lines are also true but have a lineSize of 0.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Net.MimeExtensions.FindBoundary(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds a MIME boundary.
member.param: Offset to start searching the buffer.
Maximum length to search in the buffer from the offset.
Boundary to search for within the buffer.
Returns the index of the new line at the end of the content, before the boundary. Set to -1 when no boundary was found.

Returns the index of the position after the boundary end and any CR and the LF. At the end of a MIME post the "--" MIME terminator will follow the boundary without any CR and the LF, in which case the position is set to the first character of the terminator (first character after the boundary). When no boundary was found this is set to -1 when no boundary was found.
member.returns: True if the boundary was found, otherwise false.

member.summary: Exclude the XML declaration processing instruction, i.e. <?xml version="1.0" encoding="..." ?/>

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.Xml.XmlFormatOptions.Indent
member.summary: When set indent elements according to their tree level and removes extra white space around nodes. When not set strips all white space around nodes. Use with the option to also strip white space within nodes. Include this option to make the XML easier to read. Exclude this option to save space.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.Xml.XmlFormatOptions.Trim
member.summary: Trims all content, removing white space from all element and attribute text. This is independent of the option which controls white space around nodes.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.Xml.XmlFormatOptions.OmitComments
member.summary: Removes all comments when set.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.Xml.XmlFormatOptions.OmitNamespaces
member.summary: Removes all namespaces, making them anonymous.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Xml.XmlFullExtensions.FormatXmlCopyTransform
member.summary: XSLT which simply copies all XML content. Used by the methods.
member.remarks: Normally this transform would not be needed because it does nothing and the can perform indenting directly. However for performance and to workaround an issue (wrapping a MemoryStream with a StreamWriter then an XmlWriter produces null output) all formatting is passed through the XSL engine which supports the switching of encoding at the same time as writing to an with specific settings. The used during the transform controls the indent option.

member.summary: XSLT which trims XML content fully including attribute values and element content. Used by the methods.
